case_title: WILLIAM DE NORONHA and others vs ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX and others
case_number: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No. 1020 of 1996
respondents: ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX and others
key_statutes: Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act
Section 55-A of the Income Tax Act
Section 148 of the Income Tax Act
Section 45 read with Section 9(1)(i) of the Income Tax Act

key_arguments.petitioners: Valuation of properties under orders dated February 2, 1995, and July 10, 1995, is contrary to Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act as no assessment or reassessment proceedings were pending.
key_arguments.respondents: Valuation reference is valid under Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and Section 55-A of the Income Tax Act due to pending proceedings against one of the partners under Section 148 of the Income Tax Act.

court_findings.validity_of_reference: The reference for valuation under Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and Section 55-A of the Income Tax Act is legal and valid.
court_findings.applicability_of_precedents: Cited cases (V.K. Jain v. WTO and Laxmi Devi Jain v. WTO) are not applicable to the facts of this case.

final_decision: Petition dismissed. Stay order dated October 17, 1995, vacated.
